docs.text: Gr.nim This is a plotting library for the Nim programming language. It is based on the GR framework . About GR Framework GR framework includes several libraries: GR: this library provides many functions to make easier the creation of plots. Like creating axis, grid, … GR3: this library enables creating 3D animations. GRM: this library provides an easy interface in order to create plots with minimum boilerplate.

docs.text: Contour The following code: import gr import math , random # Create x, y, z sequences with 100 items let n = 100 var x = newSeq [ float ] ( n ) var y = newSeq [ float ] ( n ) var z = newSeq [ float ] ( n ) for i in 0 .. < n : x [ i ] = 8.0 * rand ( 1.0 ) - 4.0 y [ i ] = 8.0 * rand ( 1.0 ) - 4.0 z [ i ] = sin ( x [ i ] ) + cos ( y [ i ] ) # Create the plot (a 1 liner) contour ( x , y , z ) # Wait for a key press discard readLine ( stdin ) # Cleaning grm_finalize () creates the following window:
